item.title: Deploying Microsoft Intune Cloud PKI
item.description:
Microsoft Cloud PKI, included in the Intune Suite, provides a cloud-based Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) to simplify certificate management and deployment. This blog outlines recommended practices for deploying Cloud PKI and options for integrating existing internal Certificate Authorities (CAs).

Why Cloud PKI?

Cloud PKI is particularly useful when:

  • A customer does not have an internal Windows AD Certificate Authority but wants to deploy certificates to end-user devices, for example, for 802.1x networks or VPN authentication.
  • A customer has an internal CA but, as part of a Cloud First or Cloud Native strategy, wants to:
    • Migrate certificate management and issuance entirely to the cloud (Full Cloud PKI).
    • Use the cloud for certificate issuance without relying on the internal CA and without updating existing solutions (Bring Your Own CA).

Note: Cloud PKI is not a complete replacement for an on-premises PKI. It supports certificate delivery only for Intune-managed devicesâ€”not servers, networking equipment, or appliances.
